question: Practical problems in 1 corinthians
answer:
Community factions - unity in christ by spirit

obsession with worldly wisdom and power - gods wisdom and power shown in human weakness and foolishness

fully actualized salvation NOW - Christ crucified: salvation has yet to be fully realized

body is irrelevant- only spiritual purity matters. bodily resurrection - the body is home to the spirit

social divisions in the lords supper by class and status - wait for one another, do not humiliate the poor.

We are Free! Therefore, all things are lawful - we are slaves of christ - all is lawful, but then ask "is this good for me and for Christs body?"

boasting about sexual freedoms
-do not boast! Excommunicate the offender

only the spirit matters (deny the body, its bad - abstinence in marriage. Indulge the body, it doesn't matter - prostitution and adultery)- the body matters too: it can glorify God, care for the body, teachings on abstinence, celibacy, marriage, and divorce. Be of the greater possible service to God and the community with your body

Food Sacrificed to idols DO NOT EAT or idols have no power- you can eat it. Done participate in idol worship, food is food BUT better not to eat if it harms a brother or sister. agree with the strong, side with the weak.

spiritual gifts, especially glossolalia - don't let them be disruptive or a source of pride, but don't totally prohibit them. part of the diverse but unified body, use them well to build up the community.

Love - agape- unmotivated unmerited love. defined in terms of unselfish behavior, put in the context of the ekklesia.
